_meta.description: Guide to help the user select the appropriate deployment method to run GenPipes

nodes.question: Do you have access to the Digital Research Alliance of Canada (DRAC), formerly Compute Canada?
Will you run large-scale genomic analyses using scalable computing resources (e.g cloud infrastructure)?
Will you run analyses in a local cluster (not Abacus nor DRAC) and need access to GenPipes and the CERN Virtual File System (CVMFS)?

nodes.message: Follow the tutorial here to deploy GenPipes in the DRAC infrastructure: https://genpipes.readthedocs.io/en/latest/deploy/access_gp_pre_installed.html
Follow the tutorial here to deploy GenPipes in the cloud: https://genpipes.readthedocs.io/en/latest/deploy/dep_gp_cloud_gcp.html
Follow the tutorial here to deploy GenPipes in a container: https://genpipes.readthedocs.io/en/latest/deploy/dep_gp_container.html
Follow the tutorial here to deploy GenPipes locally on your server: https://genpipes.readthedocs.io/en/latest/deploy/dep_gp_local.html
